briefTitle: Study of Outcome and Safety of Lithium, Divalproex and Risperidone for Mania in Children and Adolescents

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* DSM-IV criteria for bipolar I (manic or mixed) or mania for at least 4 weeks
* CGAS less than or equal to 60
* Good physical health

Exclusion Criteria:

* Schizophrenia or any pervasive developmental disorder
* Major medical or neurological disease
* History of addiction to illicit substances or alcohol or drug abuse within the last 4 weeks
* IQ less than 70
* Pregnancy or breast-feeding
* Unacceptable methods of contraception
* In-patient care at baseline

outcomeMeasures.title: Clinical Global Impressions-Bipolar Mania Improvement
outcomeMeasures.description: The Clinical Global Impressions-Bipolar (CGI-BP) assessment instrument measured improvement in mania, depression, and overall bipolar illness. The primary outcome measure was mania improvement, which measured the change in mania from baseline. Scores were 1=very much improved, 2=much improved, 3=minimally improved, 4=no change, 5=minimally worse, 6=much worse, 7=very much worse.

outcomeMeasures.title: Modified Side Effects Form for Children and Adolescents
outcomeMeasures.description: The Modified Side Effects Form for Children and Adolescents includes 62 potential side effects, with measures of frequency and severity for each item. Frequencies are 0=not present, 1=1-2 days, 2=3-4 days, 3=5-7 days. Severity scores are 0=not present, 1=mild (does not interfere with functioning), 2=moderate (some interference with functioning), 3=severe (functioning is significantly impaired because of side effects). Items for cardiovascular, gastrointestinal, central nervous system, ocular, mouth and nose, genito urinary, dermatology, musculo-skeletal, and other side effects are included. For analyses, side effects that were reported at any frequency and a severity of 2 or greater were considered present.

outcomeMeasures.title: K-SADS Mania Rating Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: The K-SADS Mania Rating Scale (KMRS) is comprised of 15 items modified from WASH-U-KSADS items. The individual items are scored on a 1-6 severity scale and then these item scores are summed to create an overall KMRS score. Guidelines for interpretation are as follows: 0-11 = no or minimal mania, 12-17 = mild mania, 18-25 = moderate mania, 26+ = marked or worse mania. The maximum possible score is 64.
